thread.title: UMich sentiment falls to 93.3 in July, reports say
thread.title_full: UMich sentiment falls to 93.3 in July, reports say - MarketWatch

author: By     Ruth Mantell
title: UMich sentiment falls to 93.3 in July, reports say
text: WASHINGTON (MarketWatch) -- Consumer sentiment fell to a preliminary July reading of 93.3 from a final June level of 96.1, according to reports on the University of Michigan gauge released Friday. Economists polled by MarketWatch had expected a July figure of 95. Economists follow readings on confidence to look for clues about consumer spending, the backbone of the economy. For context, the consumer-sentiment gauge averaged 86.9 over the year leading up to the recession.
